span.style: font-size:18; font-family:Comic Sans MS; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#550000
font-size:14; font-family:微软雅黑; font-weight:normal; font-style:normal; color:#000000

item.answer:
【考法 1】 n.（山间）小道： a narrow passage or gorge
【例】 They climbed up the mountain through a defile. 他们通过一条小路爬到山上。
【考法 2】 v. 亵渎： to treat (a sacred place or object) shamefully or with great disrespect
【例】 art conservators were careful not to do anything that might defile the holy relic遗迹
【近】 profane, violate
【考法 3】 v. 污染： to make unfit for use by the addition of something harmful or undesirable
【例】 supplies of meat that had been defiled by maggots蛆
【近】 befoul, foul, pollute, taint
【反】 decontaminate, purify 使纯净
【记】 源自foul 肮脏；音：地 + file 文件掉到地上弄脏了；file 锉屑能弄脏
